column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4d46da20ead35c4bdb56eac722b3fd224d50bddc for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Isn't it safer to provide a full path to the executable, to prevent the user's path from messing with it?\n
It appears the standard is to provide non-full paths, so thats what I went with.\n
I checked the desktop files in /usr/share on Ubuntu and indeed, a majority (but not all) specify a non-full path.\n
